movieReview: Mildly funny, nothing special though.  Good "bored on a weekend afternoon" flick.  Cameo by Dwight Evans.  Profoundly obnoxious product placement.
Turns out that by adding David Fincher and removing a ton of Journalism inside baseball you CAN improve on the Swedish original.
movieTitle: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011)

movieReview: Even David Tennant and McLovin' can't save this crappy script.
Real Dumb.  Real Fun.

Enjoyed a lot.  Especially it's length.. It was a 90 minute film and that's all it needed to be. It made me think it was Cronenberg's "A Straight Story".  A small, straightforward movie, somewhat out of character for Cronenberg, yet still through his prism.
Still a very good movie.  Corinna seemed to enjoy it and she doesn't really like Baseball
Made me sad and angry when I thought about how much life I have lived while these 3 men were stuck in prison.
I loved this movie when it came out, and I kind of expected it to feel really lame and dated when I started watching it.  But I was pleasantly surprised.
A crazy science fiction tale about a day when a being abducts much of the human population from Earth.
Boring.  Disappointing.  Honestly there were only a handful of 'scare' moments, but even those weren't that scary.
Beautifully shot, but felt really long.  It wasn't BAD, but I have a hard time recommending it to non film buffs.
Still lots of fun.
Word is this movie was conceived when Steven Soderbergh saw the lead actress in an MMA fight on TV.  The movie is an awesome spy action flick.
Better than I remembered....  I didn't have particularly fond memories of this movie.
I loved this movie.  Wonderful direction and cinematography, great soundtrack...  Director didn't spoon feed you.  Highly recommended.
No idea if it was real or not, but it was engaging...   Some of the filmed scenes seemed a little too convenient.
This was, by far, among the worst films I have seen in my life.
A fun idea, treating alter boy as sports film.
Typical short that gets nominated.  Tugs at the heart strings.  Poorly edited.  Never need to see it.
A little long and weird pacing, but funny engaging.
Very fun thought about time traveller who tries to perfect one day.
This will probably win the oscar, and that wouldn't be a bad outcome.  This is a quirky film that keeps surprising.
Based on a true story.  Loosely.  My favorite animated short of this season.
Perfectly fine, but nothing particularly special.
Fun short, surprised me with the punchline/ending.
Boooooooooooooooring.
movieTitle: The Fantastic Flying Books of Mr. Morris Lessmore

movieReview: I don't know what the fuck was going on here.
Way too long...  Started off enjoying it and then got bored
I feel like I've seen this several times before
Cute fake PSA
Too "clever"

It was pretty entertaining.  I liked 3/5 of the songs, the Crystal Method and Pretty Lights songs were underwhelming.  I wished they followed up with the non-dj half of the collaborations to see what they thought of the end product.
A nice little fucked up movie from the Canadian team Astron-6, produced by Troma.  If you like Troma movies, you'll probably enjoy this.
Lots of individual scenes which were great, and all of the performances were good, but it didn't really seem to add up to anything...  Not bad, but hard to recommend.
I like absurd comedy.  I can't exactly tell if this was awesome or awful.  It was entirely absurd, and probably wasn't the ideal entry point into the world of Tim & Eric.
movieTitle: Tim and Eric's Billion Dollar Movie

movieReview: I'm not a huge fan of found footage movies, but this is a pretty good one.  Took a while to get going.
Surprisingly not atrocious.  A good lazy saturday cable movie.
Not surprisingly atrocious.  I've seen worse, but it's still pretty bad.  Mercifully only 90 minutes
A dramatization of the making of a documentary.  So fucking meta.
Still great.  Bond is still Bond while toning down the sillyness that the series seems to keep trending to.
Nowhere near as good as its predecessor.  Partially a victim of the writers' strike, partially a victim of a too-aggressive schedule.
Terrible.  Simply Terrible.
Saw this again for the first time in ages.  Was great, and the Criterion Blu-ray looks stunning.
Funky little genre mash-up...  I was one of the only people at the film club who actually enjoyed it. :)
Was invited to the director's house for a very early screening of this via an IFF friend.  Was a pretty good psychological suspense movie, I look forward to seeing the finished version.
I don't think I'll shorthand CSH as a "nerd fraternity" anymore
Meh...  I'm rarely a fan of reenactments of recent history, and this was no different.
I wish it went in to a bit more detail of Achtung Baby and a little less detail on the lead-up to it, but it was still interesting.
I'm generally burned out on Nazi/Holocaust movies but this one worked for me..  Directed by Agnieszka Holland who also directed several episodes of The Wire and Tremé
Solid documentary of Magic Johnson's HIV diagnosis, announcement, and the aftermath.
Chronicles of a terrible person.  I wanted to like it, and it isn't that I disliked it, but it never quite came together...  I guess I wanted it to be funnier.
Somewhat better than I expected, but not great.  It was middling, I found myself laughing hard at some jokes but it never quite came together for me.
Just as good as the first time I saw it.
Interesting profile of a weird man.
I could watch this all day.
Saw this a long time ago and it was everything I remembered. Perfect for FUMN
I remembered this being better and more fucked up, but it was still a fun short for FUMN
Another oldie but goodie. I was afraid it'd be too art and contrived for FUMN, but those who saw it seemed to stick with it and enjoy it.
movieTitle: The Cook, the Thief, His Wife, & Her Lover

movieReview: Look up, just saw this a few weeks ago..  The few people who stayed up until 4:30am at FUMN seemed to enjoy it.
I don't care what you say, I liked this movie.
If that is faithful to the Green Lantern mythology, it is no surprise it was a flop.

Better than I expected..  I hadn't read the books but was vaguely familiar with the theme...  I would have preferred it be more violent, though I hear it was faithful.  So much of the violence was indirect, which seems like pussyfooting.
Yawn.   I heard this was a great action movie.  Those people were wrong.
This isn't really a horror movie.  It is more of a commentary with some comedy.  I don't want to spoil it.  Just see it.

Surprisingly good...  It had a few minor pacing problems, but the subjects were great (one set you're rooting for, one you're kinda rooting against, and another just for some flavor).  Overall it was well edited and well crafted.
I wasn't that excited about this movie going in but it was very well received.  It was very good.

I love a short comedy, and at 80 minutes this one fits the bill.  It was pretty tight, very well shot and edited.  Based on Mike Birbiglia's sleepwalking stories you may have heard on This American Life.
A refreshing, concise documentary following two players through the Dominican MLB system.
Felt a bit like a stretched out television special.  The story is crazy enough to keep you from caring that it is poorly made.
A great doc that spends a year with the Detroit Fire Department.

Very enjoyable except for one scene in particular.  That scene was really over the top, and located where it was it made me fear the movie was going to be constantly one-upping itself.  Fortunately this didn't happen
A cute animated short showing a conversation between a sperm whale and a human
a beautiful doc about the death and rebirth of Polaroid integral film
movieTitle: Time Zero: The Last Year of Polaroid Film

movieReview: A documentary covering Timmy Wakefield and the Knuckleball?  Of course I loved it.
Interesting but sagged in the middle for me. Maybe it's because I'm pretty familiar with anon already
movieTitle: We Are Legion: The Story of the Hacktivists

movieReview: Tons of fun..  Bobcat is way underrated as both a writer and director.
Did a good job of setting a mood and a bad job of explaining why the business was failing.
A short which pits people against each other to see who loved more as measured by fMRI. It was lots of fun.
a beautiful short doc about an interesting artist who paints with fire.
A wonderful short doc about a salon that offers free services to cancer patients one Monday a month.  I had heard it was sad but I found it to be exactly the opposite
A nifty look at the creative process across several disciplines.
Distilled Guy Maddin, but it never quite fully worked for me. Great acting, gorgeous and great soundtrack, though.
I really enjoyed it and loved learning how @seewaynewhite's work touched much of my youth.
Fantastic, showing how Ginger Baker's insanity and insane playing are a permanent fixture of his life.
This movie was tons of fun.  I didn't know all that much about Paul Williams other than some of the songs and that he would show up as a guest on lots of old game show reruns when I was a kid.

An interesting experience, I saw this movie as a rough cut a few months ago and it was neat seeing it in it's final version.  Many of the suggestions I made were taken into account.  It is a solid thriller/drama, though some of the character actions are unbelieveable
An unflinching look at a band managing to function in the face of immense opiate addiction
Both fascinating and revolting, this film looked at a billionaire family just before and after the financial collapse and how their lives were effected.

This was pretty fucking good.  Whedon did a great job giving all the characters their time and personality.  He also stayed away from tropes like forced romance or big speeches (mostly).  Some of the action scenes felt a little long as they had to give each hero their time, but that's a minor complaint.
Based on a true story.  This was ok, but you wouldn't be missing anything if you didn't see it.
A kids movie that didn't make me want to shoot myself in the head.  That said, it was pretty meh.
Still one of the (if not THE) scariest movies of all time.  Though I'm still annoyed when she goes back to save the fucking cat.
Still one of the greatest action movies of all time.  Well paced and Burke and Weyland-Yutani rival Ellis as one of the biggest assholes in movie history.
Not as good as the first two, but a nice conclusion to the series (the power of which is mostly negated by the 4th film).
Really bad.  Feels like a Sci-Fi Channel production.  Bad special effects, lame plot, and a completely out of place Dan Hedaya trying to provide "comic" relief, I guess..
A look at rock's greatest frontman from a different perspective than your average Queen documentary, relying heavily on interviews with his close family, friends and collaborators.
Sweet.  Wes Anderson-y without being cloyingly so.  It was nice to see a movie that was just pleasant without seriousness, darkness, or heavyness.
This was lots of fun.  A fan-recreated version of Star Wars could go either way, but this was a blast especially seeing it with a big group of people in the theater.
Still Real Dumb. Still Real Fun.
Really enjoyed this movie.  Some complain about the characters making some stupid actions, but humans do that all the time.
Pretty bad TV movie about the creator of AA.
Fucking terrible.  At least 40 minutes too long, and way worse than I remembered (and I didn't remember it being that good).
Liam Neeson kills everyone.  Lots of fun.

I'm probably not a good point of reference on this film, I can watch a documentary about anything, especially music.  This was good, not great, but Morphine is such a great band that it draws you along.  It doesn't help the filmmaker that Sandman was so private and deceptive about his personal life.
movieTitle: Cure for Pain: The Mark Sandman Story

movieReview: Still fantastic.
I still remember seeing this in a theater with my dad and sisters.  It doesn't stand up as well as I remember, but is still pretty funny.
In honor of Canada Day.  Still my favorite adaptation of Hamlet.
Still great the second time around.
Better-than-average "Classic Albums" style dissection of "Wish You Were Here".  Part of my current post "The Wall Live" Floyd binge.
movieTitle: Pink Floyd: The Story of Wish You Were Here

movieReview: Simply awful.
movieTitle: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace

movieReview: I had seen the parts of this interview over the years, but it was nice to see it (along with many unaired parts) in one big chunk.  Jobs is such an interesting individual.
I needed to cleanse myself after Superman IV.
Part of the Citizen Kane 70th Anniversary Bluray set.  An interesting look at the battle between Hearst and Welles, as well as looking at the lives of the  two men.
I only watched Johnny on occasion, but I always had fond memories.  Watching this really reminded me why he was special.  Also reminded me how much Jay Leno sucks.
movieTitle: Johnny Carson: King of Late Night

movieReview: Nice blend of fantasy and reality,
A fun little short featuring two friends at a diner talking about how Tarantino's movies all connect
Pretty not good.
A nice little film, sweet.  Won't blow you away but is a good date night film, also totally videoable
I've been seeing a lot of shitty horror movies lately, and while this one wasn't shitty, it was only okay.  McNulty gives it a bump up tho.
This held up pretty well.  Even Katie Holmes wasn't as bad as I remembered her.  Nice prelude to The Dark Knight.
I've seen this so many times, it's still great.  Batman's voice is ridiculous, but whatever, it's Batman.
It is hard to live up to The Dark Knight, and TDKR doesn't manage it.  But it was a very good movie and a wonderful way to cap a great series.
Even better in fucking IMAX.
Entertaining but barely.
Funny but I'm glad I watched it at home...  Though it's possible it would have been more fun in a comedy-horror audience.

So. Mediocre.  It isn't even in the league of the lesser Bourne sequels.  Too long and too much time spent trying to 'prove' it's connection to the previous films to the audience.  Would have been better throwing out the Bourne connection and just making a straight-up action thriller.

It's rare that a modern fucked up crime movie goes twisted in a way that doesn't feel contrived.  And while this movie got right up to the edge of it, it never quite crossed that line, which is nice.  I liked it, you'll feel uncomfortable at times..
Wow.  This was terrible.  It's like they made the least interesting adaptation of "A Prayer for Owen Meany" possible.
Still really good, though it definitely is showing some age...
Good dumb fun action.  If the premise of a 90 minute bicycle messenger action movie doesn't sound appealing, don't see this.  Otherwise, do.
Fun documentary that was a fly on the wall during Tim Minchin's rise from local clubs to beyond.
movieTitle: Rock + Roll Nerd: The Tim Minchin Story

movieReview: A very well produced concert film...  Minchin doesn't always work for me but this is a really good set.
Very mediocre.  Pretty standard fantasy shit.
An OK horror movie.

The movie that helped me finally decide that I hate found footage movies.  I had heard that this flick was 'different' from other found flicks.  And other than the Creepshow-esque anthology style, it was like concentrated annoying. zero stars.
I think I liked this one better the second time.
Really sad film about a heroin addict trying to get clean.
Really disappointing.  I wanted it to be a great concert film.  Instead it was a mediocre concert film with some really pretentious interview segments.
movieTitle: Shut Up and Play the Hits

movieReview: Watched this on the 25th anniversary of the film's release.  It was everything I remembered.
Still tons of fun.  Coco hadn't seen it and wanted to so I watched it again
It may have been better than I remembered.
Still so great..  Not sure, but I think this might be the first time I saw it on the big screen.  It came out before I started keeping track of what I see.
I bought this when Louie released it as a DRM-free download on his site but just got around to watching it.  It was hilarious.
movieTitle: Louis C.K.: Live at the Beacon Theater

movieReview: Missing some of the 'charm' of the original, but still a decent dumb fun movie.  Takes too long to get going, imo
Coco had somehow never seen this.  Looked surprisingly good given it's age..  To think of all the movies which came afterwards with digital effects which don't look half as good today.
Not as scary as I would have hoped but it was OK..
Really good.  Firmed up the notion in my mind that Affleck is a good director and not just a fluke
Fascinating.  It's amazing how little help the leagues seem to give to these players, though I'm not sure how much it would help.
I've never really cared about the olympics, but there was enough intrigue in this story to keep me mostly entertained.  It was definitely 'i'm bored lets put something on' territory, though

My sisters and I watched this flick a bunch as kids.  I'm actually pretty certain the only reason we watched it was that it made the crazy dance our father did, The Freddie, into a real thing as opposed to a crazy thing that dad made up.  When I saw it sitting on the Tivo I couldn't help myself.  But this is not actually a good movie.
Everyone remembers this movie being pretty bad, but I don't think it is judged fairly.  It isn't as good as Ghostbusters, but it also isn't terrible.  I enjoyed it.
Really, really good.  It was like a good version of the idea that Adaptation attempted.
OK, but mostly rehash for me.
Dragged...  Mostly I remember Liam Neeson's creepy toe-thumbs.
Remove 45 minutes (including the terrible coda) and you might have a good film.
The history of Ole Miss is so troubling, but it is mostly new to me.
A nice, small movie about a remarkable man.

I thought this would be pretty bad, but even at 2.75 hours I was engaged the whole time.  The cutting back and forth between stories worked better than I would have imagined.  It was pretty good..  The friend I saw it with and I had a very long discussion afterwards.
I so love Mr. Plinkett..  In this commentary he talks about a movie he loves and why it is so much better than the prequels..
Not as good as Casino Royale, but still pretty damn fun.
Pretty lame.  Not that funny, but not exactly BAD

Daniel Day Lewis will get the oscar nomination, and he will deserve it.  Spielberg reined in his usual tendencies and crafted a pretty good film.  It is amazing how many recognizable faces are in this movie.
Really great sci-fi.
Really, really boring.
I literally knew NOTHING about the Dust Bowl, so I was really interested in this film.  Ken Burns knows how to craft a documentary, and this was no exception.
First time seeing it on the big screen (and a pretty nice 35mm print to boot!) and it was actually better than I remembered (and I was pretty fond of it to start).

Bleh.  Parts of it really worked, and parts of it didn't.  Hopkins' impression of Hitch was pretty poor, and the movie seem to play it too fast and loose.  The scenes with Ed Gein were particularly painful.
Had some funny moments, but overall was a drag.

Saw this in 48fps 3D.  I enjoyed the film itself quite a bit.  If you liked the LOTR films, you'll probably like this.  48fps, though, was a middling-to-poor thing.  When I noticed it, it was bothersome, and the rest of the time that I didn't 'notice' it it didn't seem to improve anything.
Post-apocalyptic film, sun is too bright, everything is fucked.  Pretty good
I hadn't seen Caddyshack in eons.  It was still hilarious
Greatest action movie of all time.
A quirky finnish Christmas movie, more violent and weird than most people would like for Christmas Fare (but less so than Die Hard).  It worked for me for sure.
I can't imagine a Christmas without this movie.
Meh.  Others seemed to enjoy it more than I did...  I was kind bored at times.
Still really makes me smile...  I feel like it had been a few years since we watched it as a family.
It turns out when you watch as many movies as I do, your family wants to see something you've already seen over the holidays.
It turns out when you watch as many movies as I do, your family wants to see something you've already seen over the holidays.
I saw this in the theaters when it came out, but it ended up being better than I remembered the second time around.
